hanzi-su-wiki:
銃

Значения

Ружьё, винтовка

Мнемоника

Металлическое 金 ружьё, которое как младенца 充 надо кормить, т.е. заряжать порохом и дробью.

Варианты

铳

chòng
ancient firearm; gun
старинное огнестрельное оружие; пистолет
rtega_mnemonic:
銃銃RS
铳铳		ancient weapon, blunderbuss
  • mature person 充 holding a metal 金 object: a weapon
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 铳)
Pictophonetic: 充 indicates the sound; 釒 (metal) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 充 [ chōng ] to fill, to supply; to be full
heisig_constituent: gun, metal, gold, allot, infant, toddler, top hat, elbow, human legs
koohiiStory1: Everyone is allotted a metal gun (US constitution according to the NRA).
koohiiStory2: What is a gun but a device for allotting pieces of metal? One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...etc.
jp_example_words:
銃(つつ): gun
銃(じゅう): gun
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You need to allocate enough gold to buy a gun. Guns are weapons of the old world, so you can't just buy them with paper money. Guns have to be bought with gold coins and slabs and bricks.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture yourself handing over an armful of gold bars to buy a single gun.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You need this gun so you can steal some jewels (じゅう)! Why didn't you just use your gold to buy the jewels, you ask? Because! That's not how we did things in olden days. When you want jewels you buy a gun with gold and rob a jewelry store!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture an old fashioned hold up. You're holding a gun and shoveling jewels into a burlap sack. The heist of the century!
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 統 (すべる、トウ объединять).
Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), 儿 (ножки), 厶 (значок МУ), 金 (золото)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: your allotted (充) gold (金) is a gun

①斧頭上受柄的孔。
②古代用火藥發射彈丸的一種火器。［合］火銃；鳥銃。
③金屬製的打眼器具，即銃子。

銃字的基本解释

銃
chòng
见“铳”。

銃字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chòng］
［《廣韻》充仲切，去送，昌。］
“铳1”的繁体字。
(1)用火药发射弹丸的管形火器。
(2)用火器射击。
(3)金属制的打眼器具。参见“銃子”。
(4)方言。扒窃。
(5)指用言语顶撞人。

銃字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　銃； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1304第03
【集韻】充仲切，音?。【玉篇】銎也。【集韻】斧穿也。　又【字彙補】銃䨻，蜀語也。見黃山谷集。　又【集韻】昌六切，音俶。義同。

銃字的源字形

pistol
Basic explanation of words
pistol
chòng
See "Bun".
pistol
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chòng］
["Guangyun" fills the middle and cuts, goes to send, Chang. ]
Traditional characters for "铳1".
(1) A tubular firearm that uses gunpowder to fire projectiles.
(2) Shoot with firearms.
(3) Metal punching equipment. See "Bunzi".
(4) Dialects. Pickpocketing.
(5) Refers to confronting people with words.
pistol
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Xu Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　铳; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 1304 No. 03
[Jiyun] fills the middle and cuts, the sound?. [Jade articles] Li also. [Jiyun] Axe wears also.　[Word Supplement] 铳䨻, Shuyu also. See Huangshan Valley Collection.　[Jiyun] Chang six cuts, sound chu. The same meaning.

chòng
вм. 铳
Radicals: 金, 充  (gold, allocate)
Meaning Mnemonic
You need to allocate enough gold to buy a gun. Guns are weapons of the old world, so you can't just buy them with paper money. Guns have to be bought with gold coins and slabs and bricks.
Picture yourself handing over an armful of gold bars to buy a single gun.
Reading Mnemonic
You need this gun so you can steal some jewels (じゅう)! Why didn't you just use your gold to buy the jewels, you ask? Because! That's not how we did things in olden days. When you want jewels you buy a gun with gold and rob a jewelry store!
Picture an old fashioned hold up. You're holding a gun and shoveling jewels into a burlap sack. The heist of the century!
